results.title: A Short story about love
results.creator_credit: Karen Wootton and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Karen is young, travelling and in love. When she returns from her travels she discovers she has HIV and with this diagnosis her life changes. Karen must come to terms with life’s new circumstances as she laments the fact that she may never have another relationship or be a mother. But life does move on for Karen and with the help of friends and family, Karen finds love again.

results.title: The Gift
results.brief_description: Deanna is given a real gift in life, this gift is really challenging but as she begins to understand the nature of this gift she understands its true importance.

results.title: The Blue Nile
results.creator_credit: Kathrine Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Through civil war Kathrine’s family are forced to change their lives, language and religion and eventually their country. Kathrine and her family are now living in Australia and they feel safe and have a chance to realise their dreams. Kathrine wants to make sure her children understand their cultural heritage and hopes that one day she can show them the Blue Nile.

results.title: Sudan: a new vision
results.creator_credit: Nychuat Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A lot of people made sacrifices in an attempt to free South Sudan from civil war. Nychuat and her family now live in Australia but they are deeply connected to Sudan and in honour and respect for those that have made sacrifices, they work tirelessly to support the freedom movement in Sudan. This story explores Nychaut’s relationship with her two countries, Australia and Sudan.

results.title: Recovering hope
results.brief_description:
‘Recovering Hope’ captures the personal stories of women who fled their homeland Vietnam for a new life in Australia. Sinking boats, pirates and transit camps were experiences for many as they made the dangerous journey.
This Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House, marks the 30th anniversary of the first wave of migration.

results.title: Possums of Bonegilla
results.creator_credit: Agnes Karlik and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Agnes talks of her migrant experience including her time spent at Bonegilla. She especially focuses on friendships made during those early years of alienation and loneliness.

results.title: Being positive
results.creator_credit: Heather Ellis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A sensitive and warmly told story by Heather Ellis, mother and wife, diagnosed HIV positive in 1997 upon returning to Australia from a trip to Africa. Heather’s greatest fear is the stigma which may be attached to her son Ethan who is HIV negative but yet she feels privileged that medication is available in Australia for recovery and prevention of positive babies being born. In Africa they do not have this privilege.

results.title: Qesa story
results.creator_credit: Yvonne Kyriakos and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Qesa means story in Arabic and Yvonne Kyriakos from the Craig Family Centre believes that it is the stories that come with the newly arrived communities that helps them to connect not only with their own communities but also with their new communities. The Centre offers support and assistance with empathy, respect and appreciation of these stories which share past experiences, cultures and traditions.
